title: PepsiCo to cut prices, eliminate products as part of a deal with an activist investor
description: PepsiCo plans to cut prices and eliminate some of its products under a deal with an activist investor announced Monday.  The Purchase, New York-based company, which makes Cheetos, Tostitos and other Frito-Lay products as well as beverages, said it will cut nearly 20% of its product offerings by early next year.  PepsiCo said it will use the savings to invest in marketing and improved value for consumers.
fullText:
PepsiCo plans to cut prices and eliminate some of its products under a deal with an activist investor announced Monday.

The Purchase, New York-based company, which makes Cheetos, Tostitos and other Frito-Lay products as well as beverages, said it will cut nearly 20% of its product offerings by early next year. PepsiCo said it will use the savings to invest in marketing and improved value for consumers. It didn't disclose which products or how much it would cut prices.

PepsiCo said it also plans to accelerate the introduction of new offerings with simpler and more functional ingredients, including Doritos Protein and Simply NKD Cheetos and Doritos, which contain no artificial flavors or colors. The company also recently introduced a prebiotic version of its signature cola.

PepsiCo is making the changes after prodding from Elliott Investment Management, which took a $4 billion stake in the company in September. In a letter to PepsiCo‚Äôs board, Elliott said the company is being hurt by a lack of strategic clarity, decelerating growth and eroding profitability in its North American food and beverage businesses.

In a joint statement with PepsiCo Monday, Elliott Partner Marc Steinberg said the firm is confident that PepsiCo can create value for shareholders as it executes on its new plan.

‚ÄúWe appreciate our collaborative engagement with PepsiCo‚Äôs management team and the urgency they have demonstrated,‚Äù Steinberg said. ‚ÄúWe believe the plan announced today to invest in affordability, accelerate innovation and aggressively reduce costs will drive greater revenue and profit growth.‚Äù

Elliott said it plans to continue working closely with the company.

PepsiCo shares were flat in after-hours trading Monday.

PepsiCo said it expects organic revenue to grow between 2% and 4% in 2026. The company‚Äôs organic revenue rose 1.5%. the first nine months of this year.

PepsiCo also said it plans to review its supply chain and continue to make changes to its board, with a focus on global leaders who can help it reach its growth and profitability goals.

‚ÄúWe feel encouraged about the actions and initiatives we are implementing with urgency to improve both marketplace and financial performance,‚Äù PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta said in a statement.

PepsiCo said in February that years of double-digit price increases and changing customer preferences have weakened demand for its drinks and snacks. In July, the company said it was trying to combat perceptions that its products are too expensive by expanding distribution of value brands like Chester‚Äôs and Santitas.

title: üî• My club, my home: Podolski buys shares in his beloved team
description: Lukas Podolski joins G√≥rnik Zabrze as a co-owner. The city of Zabrze, still the largest shareholder, had initiated the ongoing privatization process.The Rio World Champion is participating in G√≥rnik...
fullText:
Lukas Podolski joins G√≥rnik Zabrze as a co-owner. The city of Zabrze, still the largest shareholder, had initiated the ongoing privatization process.

The Rio World Champion is participating in G√≥rnik with his company LP Holding GmbH. By purchasing 104,611 registered shares, he acquires 8.3 percent of the shares, making him the second-largest shareholder behind the city of Zabrze.

"Lukas Podolski's entry into the shareholder structure is the first formal step towards taking over the club and underscores his long-standing and sincere commitment to the development of G√≥rnik," the club announced.

Podolski, who has been playing for G√≥rnik Zabrze since 2021, stated in a statement: "G√≥rnik Zabrze is my club, my home, and my football family. I am very pleased to take the next step and actively participate in the future of G√≥rnik. I believe in this project and the people behind it. I want the club to continue developing on a solid foundation ‚Äì in sports, organization, and economics."

title: 'Big Short' investor Michael Burry warned early about subprime excess ‚Äî now he's betting on Fannie and Freddie IPOs
description: The Trump administration has signaled interest in releasing Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac from conservatorship.
fullText:
"Big Short" investor Michael Burry sounded early alarms about the subprime mortgage market's excesses ‚Äî the same risks that later engulfed mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

Now, Burry wrote in a Substack post on Monday that he owns "good size" positions in both companies' common stock ‚Äî and believes a long-awaited plan to take them public again may finally be approaching.

"Once each company is released from capital restraint by their IPOs, I expect growth to accelerate naturally," he wrote.

In his 6,000-word analysis, Burry wrote that the mortgage giants contributed to the housing bubble by buying large volumes of risky loans that eventually blew up during the financial crisis.

Burry recalled that he saw the danger early. In 2003, he called Freddie "Frauddie Mac" in an investor letter and bought credit-default swaps that would pay off if the company faltered.

Now in 2025, Burry argues the landscape has changed. Fannie and Freddie have rebuilt tens of billions in capital since 2021 and remain essential pillars of the US mortgage market, owning 62% of outstanding home loans.

With the Trump administration now signaling interest in releasing them from conservatorship, Burry believes their IPOs may be nearing.

However, "there remains a final steep, windy and rocky climb to IPO for both," he wrote, citing regulatory and policy roadblocks.

Shares of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, which trade over the counter, rose 2% and 2.4%, respectively, on Monday.

Burry's post came a month after he closed his hedge fund to outside investors, after terminating Scion Asset Management's SEC registration.

Since then, he has launched his "Cassandra Unchained" Substack that promises a "front row seat to his analytical efforts and projections for stocks, markets, and bubbles, often with an eye to history and its remarkably timeless patterns." It now has over 146,000 subscribers.
